story.text: A __smart contract__ is a computer protocol intended to digitally facilitate, verify, or enforce the negotiation or performance of a [[contract]]. Smart contracts allow the performance of credible transactions without third parties. These transactions are trackable and irreversible - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smart_contract wikipedia]

Proponents of smart contracts claim that many kinds of contractual clauses may be made partially or fully self-executing, self-enforcing, or both. The aim of smart contracts is to provide security that is superior to traditional contract law and to reduce other [[transaction costs]] associated with contracting. Various [[cryptocurrency]] have implemented types of smart contracts.
